info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 12 at 3:09PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN ROANOKE...SOUTHWESTERN BEDFORD AND NORTHERN FRANKLIN COUNTIES...THE CITY OF SALEM AND THE CITY OF ROANOKE THROUGH 345 PM EDT... At 309 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Poages Mill, or near Salem, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Roanoke... Salem... Vinton... Boones Mill... Stewartsville... Moneta... and Bent Mountain. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
